question: In the 1946 elections, Manuel Roxas founded the ________ to campaign against Pres. Sergio Osmena Sr.
True or False. The Philippines in 1946 gained independence without the assistance of the Americans.
The Philippine Rehabilitation Act appropriated ___________ pesos providing the Filipino public with their needs.
Because of the lack of national funds for national security, the Philippines entered agreements with the United States. The first one is ________.
This pact exploited the Philippines’ national military resources under the guise of “mutual agreement”.
The __________ allowed the United States to exploit natural resources from the Philippines.
___________ gave American citizens and corporations the right to natural resources from the Philippines equal to that of Filipino citizens.
The HUKs, comprised of peasants and farmers, asked for ___________ from the Roxas Administration.
The HUKs were declared as a _________ and ________ organization because of their Communist leanings.
Magsaysay proposed to use the military and a CIA-initiated organization called the _______ to guard the polls for the 1951 elections.
